intro: Jussiaea elongata, commonly known as the elongated jussiaea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, white or pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its leaves are usually opposite and lance-shaped, while its flowers are often clustered in racemes. Jussiaea elongata is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in wetland ecosystems.
